title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When a "DateTime" type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer, and an invalid date string is entered in the "defaultValue" field (e.g. "55/66/9999"), the invalid value is accepted. The report design shows the following definition: 
<parameters>
	<scalarparameter name="dateParam1">
		<property name="dataType">dateTime</property>
		<property name="allowBlank">false</property>
		<property name="format">Unformatted</property>
		<property name="controlType">textbox</property>
		<expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression>
	</scalarparameter>
</parameters>
Two problems exist here: 
(1) The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/), which is locale independent and ensures portability.
EB: The BIRT report designer should reject invalid date/time strings entered in the "defaultValue" field of a "DateTime" type report parameter.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer. 
2. Create a new report. 
3. Add a new parameter of type "DateTime". 
4. In the "defaultValue" field of the parameter, enter an invalid date/time string that does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format (e.g. "55/66/9999"). 
5. Check if the invalid value is accepted and the report design shows the incorrect definition mentioned in the bug report.
